results.title: Italian settlement in the Yarra Valley
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Maria McCarthy and ACMI
results.brief_description: Maria McCarthy recalls the stories from her youth, the ones told about her families’ voyage from Italy to Australia and settling in the Yarra Valley. She tells of her parents’ adoption of a new culture and way of life and the legacy of those decisions on the present.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Maria McCarthy and ACMI
results.description: Maria McCarthy recalls the stories from her youth, the ones told about her families’ voyage from Italy to Australia and settling in the Yarra Valley. She tells of her parents’ adoption of a new culture and way of life and the legacy of those decisions on the present.

results.title: Foot in the air
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Laura Brearley and ACMI
results.brief_description: In Farsi, the word for transition translates as foot in the air. With one foot in the air, Laura Brearley’s life changes dramatically. The injuries she sustained have lasted throughout her life, but they are indicative of both her vulnerability and resilience. On reflection, she realises her transition was not all bad, after all.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Laura Brearley and ACMI
results.description: In Farsi, the word for transition translates as foot in the air. With one foot in the air, Laura Brearley’s life changes dramatically. The injuries she sustained have lasted throughout her life, but they are indicative of both her vulnerability and resilience. On reflection, she realises her transition was not all bad, after all.

results.title: My ambitions
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, David Clune and ACMI
results.brief_description: Since David Clune first travelled to Japan at 16, he developed a thirst for travel that has never been quenched. In all his travels, he has witnessed suffering amongst the beauty and it has encouraged in him a desire to make a difference, even though he is content in Australia…for now.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, David Clune and ACMI
results.description: Since David Clune first travelled to Japan at 16, he developed a thirst for travel that has never been quenched. results.title: Where my heart lies
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Vicki Baker and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vicki Baker, mother of three, grew up in the bush but eventually had to move to town to find employment. She recalls her childhood days of family and the freedom of running through the bush with the wind in her hair and not a care in the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Vicki Baker and ACMI

results.title: Grumpy old man
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Richard Bailey and ACMI
results.brief_description: Richard Bailey has nudged and niggled people and he’s had some success, especially on the asbestos issue. A heart attack in 2003 meant that Bailey couldn’t be as active anymore, so he decided to direct his energies elsewhere.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Richard Bailey and ACMI

results.title: A Little bit of willpower
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Leanda Bunn and ACMI
results.brief_description: Kicked out of home at the age of 15 and struggling with depression, Leanda Bunn still managed to complete her VCE, find accommodation and be independent thanks to a few very special people in her life and a lot of willpower.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Leanda Bunn and ACMI

results.title: Days of clear water
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Emma Case and ACMI
results.brief_description: Emma describes her life growing up with her nan, an independent lady who loved to tend to her garden and go for walks along the river. When her nan passed away, Emma lost not only her nan but her best friend.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Emma Case and ACMI

results.title: I spell I can't...I can!
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Edie Collet and ACMI
results.brief_description: Edie Collet’s beginnings were difficult - her mother died giving birth and she was diagnosed as being handicapped. Collet was raised by her father and siblings to become an educated, well travelled and independent adult. Collet was told she would never work but she proved them wrong. This story is dedicated to Collet’s dad.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Edie Collet and ACMI

results.title: In memory of Mark and Dusty
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Denise Thompson and ACMI
results.brief_description: It is ten years since the tragic passing of Denise Thompson’s son Mark and the family dog Dusty. A loving tribute by a mother to her son and the pet dog he gave her when he was little.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Denise Thompson and ACMI

results.title: The Wolf
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Beverly Bailey and ACMI
results.brief_description: It was Beverly Bailey’s husband who suggested she take the trip to England and Canada to meet his family. As Bailey disappeared through the airport door her husband wondered if he’d said the wrong thing.
